edu.drexel.cs.jah473.autocorrect

Class Autocorrect

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.drexel.cs.jah473.datastructures.Trie
      • edu.drexel.cs.jah473.autocorrect.Autocorrect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<String>, Collection<String>, Set<String>

    public class Autocorrect
extends Trie
    Class for generating suggestions for misspelled words. Suggestions are taken from a user-defined corpus of valid words. The class contains three main algorithms for generating suggestions: autocomplete, Levenshtein Edit Distance, and whitespace.

    In addition to generating suggestions using the three algorithms individually, the user can generate suggestions using any combination (or all) of the algorithms via the suggest function.

    The user has four options for automatically sorting suggestions that come as a result of the suggest function. The default is keyboard distance sort, which uses the KeyboardDistanceComparator class to rank suggestions based on the keyboard distance between the typo(s) in the misspelled word and the corresponding character(s) in the suggestion. This method produces extremely relevant results and is highly recommended. Alternatively, the user can choose LED sort mode to sort using an LEDComparator, custom sort mode along with a user-provided comparator, or unsorted mode.

    Post-construction changes to the corpus may be made via the dynamic operations in the Trie class.
    Author:
    Justin Horvitz
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • CUSTOM_SORT

        public static final int CUSTOM_SORT
        A constant representing custom sort mode. The integral value of this constant is 2.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEYBOARD_DISTANCE_SORT

        public static final int KEYBOARD_DISTANCE_SORT
        A constant representing sort by keyboard distance mode (the default mode). The integral value of this constant is 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LED_SORT

        public static final int LED_SORT
        A constant representing LED sort mode. The integral value of this constant is 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNSORTED

        public static final int UNSORTED
        A constant representing unsorted suggestions mode. The integral value of this constant is 3.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Autocorrect

        public Autocorrect(Collection<String> corpus,
                   boolean strictCaps)
        Constructs a new Autocorrect object using the given corpus. Future changes to the given corpus will not affect this autocorrect.
        Parameters:
        corpus - the words to be considered correctly spelled words
        strictCaps - whether to treat capital letters as unique

      • Autocorrect

        public Autocorrect(Collection<String> corpus,
                   boolean strictCaps,
                   Comparator<? super String> comparator)
        Constructs a new Autocorrect object using the given corpus and comparator.
        Parameters:
        corpus - the words to be considered correctly spelled words
        strictCaps - whether to treat capital letters as unique
        comparator - the comparator to be used for custom sorting, which will be turned on

      • Autocorrect

        public Autocorrect(Collection<String> corpus,
                   boolean strictCaps,
                   int sortMode)
        Constructs a new Autocorrect object using the given corpus and sort mode. If the given sort mode is custom sort mode, suggestions will remain unsorted until a comparator is set via setComparator(Comparator).
        Parameters:
        corpus - the words to be considered correctly spelled words
        strictCaps - whether to treat capital letters as unique
        sortMode - the sorting mode to use when generating suggestions

        Generates a list of all words in the corpus that begin with the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to autocomplete
        Returns:
        an unsorted list of all words in the corpus that begin with the given prefix

      • getComparator

        public Comparator<? super String> getComparator()

        Returns:
        the comparator being used by this autocorrect

        public int getMaxLED()
        Gets the current maximum LED allowed.
        Returns:
        the current maximum LED allowed

      • getSortMode

        public int getSortMode()
        Returns the sort mode being used by this autocorrect. The pre-defined default sort mode is keyboard distance sort mode.
        Returns:
        the integral value of the sort mode being used by this autocorrect

      • led

        public static int led(String word1,
                      String word2)
        Calculates the Levenshtein Edit Distance (LED) between two words
        Parameters:
        word1 - the first word
        word2 - the second word
        Returns:
        the LED between the two words

      • setComparator

        public void setComparator(Comparator<? super String> comparator)
        Sets this autocorrect to use the given comparator and turns on custom sort mode.
        Parameters:
        comparator - the comparator to use for future suggestions

      • setMaxLED

        public void setMaxLED(int maxLED)
        Sets the maximum LED allowed.
        Parameters:
        maxLED - the maximum LED to allow, cannot be negative

      • setSortMode

        public void setSortMode(int sortMode)
        Sets this autocorrect to use the given sort mode. Valid sort modes can be passed via KEYBOARD_DISTANCE_SORT, LED_SORT, CUSTOM_SORT, or UNSORTED which represent integers 0-3 respectively. If the given sort mode is custom sort mode, suggestions will remain unsorted until a comparator is set via setComparator(Comparator), unless a comparator was passed during construction.
        Parameters:
        sortMode - the integral value of the sort mode to use

      • suggest

        public List<String> suggest(String word)
        Returns a list of all suggestions generated according to the algorithms this autocorrect is using.
        Parameters:
        word - the word from which to generate suggestions
        Returns:
        a list of all suggestions, sorted by the sorting mode this autocorrect is using.

      • suggestLED

        public List<String> suggestLED(String word)
        Generates a list of all words in this autocorrect's corpus within the currently allowed maximum LED of the given word. The pre-defined maximum LED is 3, but this can be changed using setMaxLED(int).
        Parameters:
        word - the word from which to generate suggestions
        Returns:
        an unsorted list of all words in this autocorrect's corpus within the default maximum LED of the given word

      • suggestLED

        public List<String> suggestLED(String word,
                               int maxLED)
        Generates a list of all words in this autocorrect's corpus within the given LED of the given word. Supplying the maximum LED will temporarily override, but not change, this autocorrect's current maximum allowed LED.
        Parameters:
        word - word the word from which to generate suggestions
        maxLED - the maximum Levenshtein Edit Distance (LED) allowed, cannot be negative
        Returns:
        an unsorted list of all words in this autocorrect's corpus within the given LED of the given word

      • suggestWhitespace

        public List<String> suggestWhitespace(String word)
        Generates a list of all valid bigrams that can be created by inserting a space into the given word at any position.
        Parameters:
        word - the word from which to generate suggestions
        Returns:
        a list of all valid bigrams that result from splitting the given word
